                      <div data-reactid="654">
                       private, single-family home is conveniently located near the best that Los Angeles, Beverly Hills, and West Hollywood have to offer. Bedroom rental w private bathroom, view of Hollywood Hills, Private Entrance, &amp; private Parking, Centrally located, one block from Beverly Hills Border on San Vicente, walking distance to Cedars Sinai, W 3rd Street shopping, LACMA , The Bedroom rental. it is a quiet, spacious, and uncluttered. the neighborhood is beautiful, quiet, safe and friendly. street Parking w district 34 pass, detached bathroom, Kitchen, and breakfast nook. Centrally located, one block from Beverly Hills Border on San Vicente, walking distance to Cedars Sinai, W 3rd Street shopping, LACMA , The Grove, The Beverly Connection, West Hollywood and original Farmers Market Walking distance to Saban Theatre. AC in room is portable We walk or ride our bikes to the swim club next door to LA county Museum of Art (LACMA) its an olympian size pool, salt water, salt water jacuzzi 104 degrees. its part of our membership, we can offer it to our guest but there is a fee of 20 dollars to use the pool &amp; gym facilities as it is a private swim club We like our guest to have maximum privacy, and we keep busy schedules. Our home was built 1934 but its quiet, spacious, uncluttered, and clean. the neighborhood is beautiful, quiet, safe and friendly, pet friendly too. We welcome your pet but it will count as a guest Rodeo Drive, Robertson Blvd, Melrose and West Hollywood shops are withing a 1/4 mile. We also have two Townie Bikes you can use. If you choose to park on the street we have a parking pass. Transit is central as well, buses to the trains are two blocks from our house. Our Pool at Park La Brea is available to our guest for a fee of 20$ for the day (URL HIDDEN)

                      <div data-reactid="778">
                       Exclusive Newly Custom Designed Renovated Private Guesthouse in Heart of Los Angeles in Miracle Mile. Centrally Located near L.A. Hotspots: EAST of Beverly Hills, Robertson, West Hollywood, Santa Monica, Malibu, and Venice Beach. WEST of Downtown LA., Koreatown, USC. SOUTH of Hollywood Hills, Universal Studios, Sunset Blvd., Santa Monica Blvd. and West 3rd. Street. NORTH of Wilshire Blvd. and LAX. Walking Distance from The Grove Shopping Center/ Farmer's Market, The Beverly Center, LACMA, West 3rd Street shops, restaurants and conveniences such as Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Bed, Bath and Beyond. 1 Car Parking steps away from your unit on a private gated 6300 S.F. 2 building lot with lovely outdoor space. GALLEY KITCHEN: Glass shelving with essential utensils and cookware, Stainless Steel Microwave and Sink, Electric Grill, Mini Fridge, Coffeemaker, Juicer and a 2 Burner Electric Cooktop. (No stove/ oven.) BEDROOM: Full Sized Bed, multi shelved cabinets, hand carved night stand, night lamp and double mirror door wardrobe COZY MODERN BATHROOM: 2 Sets of Small, Medium, and Large towels, cozy bathrugs, blow-dryer, shampoo, conditioner, soap/ body wash, glass cleaning squeegie, cleaning agents. LIVINGROOM: Convertible foam loveseat/ full sized couch bed, end tables, coffee table, 28" LED Color HDTV with remote, oscillating fan (no A/C in unit), tower heater, 2 shelves, and foldable eat-in kitchen table. Derived from a garage conversion. REFINED FEATURES: Recessed Lighting, French Doors and Wireless Wi-Fi. EXCLUSIVE ZEN BACK YARD PATIO GARDEN RIGHT IN FRONT OF UNIT 1 CAR DESIGNATED PARKING IN REAR YARD STEPS AWAY FROM UNIT $75-175/ month pet fee dependent on size, length of stay and maintenance required to cover extra care and cleaning to remove pet hair, odors and dander from furniture and floors.

                       Situated midpoint between Downtown LA and Venice/ Santa Monica Beach, Culver City and Koreatown, West Hollywood, Hollywood Hills, Sunset Strip and Beverly Hills. 20-30 minutes away from LAX. Hip hangout spots are found around the corner 2 steers away while this guest unit rests in back of a private multi-unit property, off a quaint tree lined residential pet friendly street.

                       <li data-reactid="805"><p data-reactid="806">This is a modern 2 bedroom spread over two floors with the bedrooms with ensuites upstairs and the main living areas downstairs. Upstairs is carpeted and downstairs is not. The hosts have provided almost everything you could want including consumables (toilet paper, dishwashing supplies etc). It appears almost new, with easy parking under the building and right next to the lift! There is a bath in the spare bedroom (perfect for families), and the master has a standup shower. The neighborhood felt safe but I can't speak to its walkability. We never saw another person in the apartment building but could hear them walking above the master some times. That said, it didn't disturb us during sleep hours. I do feel obliged to tell those considering staying that the apartment is close to a flight path but there are no planes during sleeping time so there is little inconvenience. Check in was a breeze! They were very accommodating allowing us to checkin very last minute (same afternoon we enquired) and got the place ready fast so we didn't have to wait long. They also had terrific communication and were helpful when contacting with requests. Given these great hosts, and fantastic set up, we are glad we stayed!</p><span data-reactid="807">Tim</span><span data-reactid="808">2015-09-16T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                       <svg viewbox="0 0 32 32" style="height:32px;width:32px;display:block;" fill="#484848" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#ffffff" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" data-reactid="900">
                        <path d="M23.993 2.75c-.296 0-.597.017-.898.051-1.14.131-2.288.513-3.408 1.136-1.23.682-2.41 1.621-3.688 2.936-1.28-1.316-2.458-2.254-3.687-2.937-1.12-.622-2.268-1.004-3.41-1.135a7.955 7.955 0 0 0-.896-.051C6.123 2.75.75 4.289.75 11.128c0 7.862 12.238 16.334 14.693 17.952a1.004 1.004 0 0 0 1.113 0c2.454-1.618 14.693-10.09 14.693-17.952 0-6.84-5.374-8.378-7.256-8.378" data-reactid="901"></path>

                    <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="902">
                     <div data-reactid="903">
                      <div data-reactid="904">
                       This extraordinary apartment is a huge well-appointed 3-bedroom upper flat in a duplex with old-world, 1920's, Mediterranean charm with all the original architectural details. There's a lovely front porch for enjoying L.A.'s weather.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="905">
                       This well-appointed guest room has a firm comfortable, full bed with excellent bedding. There are available drawers and walk-in closet space, as well as, zippy WiFi. It has its own lovely private bath/shower. There is central AC &amp; Heat, a large working fireplace, and free laundry facilities. The free safe street parking is usually easy. If there is ever a problem, there is one space in front of my garage door. I am not at all territorial and have indicated on the photos which areas are shared and which are private. If you are more comfortable hanging out in your comfortable room - no problem. If you prefer hanging out or have work you'd like to spread out in any of the shared spaces - again, no problem. If you'd like to cook or watch the HDTV in the Living Room, great! It's all about what makes you comfortable. As much or as little as you'd like. I can treat you like family or just be your personal concierge. Or I can act like you're invisible. I take my cues from my guests. I love this area because it's safe and convenient to everything because it's right in the middle of LA. I'm 1.5 miles from LACMA as well as Rodeo Drive. An easy walk (4-10 blocks) to the Robertson Blvd. shopping district and the Paparazzi-soaked Ivy and Kitson. It's 2 miles to The Grove/Farmers Market and 2 miles to the center of West Hollywood. 1 mile from Cedars-Sinai and the Beverly Center. I'm a 10 minute drive to Culver City, 15 minute drive to the heart of Hollywood or the ocean and a 20-minute drive from LAX or to Downtown. There are buses going in all directions surrounding me. N/S buses going up and down La Cienega &amp; Robertson. And E/W buses going across Wilshire &amp; Olympic. None more than 2-4 blocks away. The closest train is 10 minutes south in Culver City. There is also a new free smart phone app for coordinating your travel about the sprawling city that includes maps and routes for all buses and trains. It's called Go511. I have a young Cocker Spaniel goof-ball and a small mutt who are sweet, mostly very quiet and have never met anyone they don't like.
                      </div>

                    <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="1026">
                     <div data-reactid="1027">
                      <div data-reactid="1028">
                       My place is the perfect place to stay when visiting Los Angeles, West Hollywood, or Beverly Hills. It is a perfect location close to many restaurants, shopping and sights. Private patio behind and interior has large flat screen TV with fast Wifi!
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1029">
                       Welcome to my apartment! Let me tell you a bit about my home and the neighborhood. My home is a one bedroom house that has been recently renovated. If you rent the apartment, it is private rental of the entire apartment, so no one stays there with you. All of the furniture is in excellent condition and all of the linens and towels are new and fresh. The apartment has a great TV area with a couch, coffee table and chair and a large high definition TV that is connected to the free WiFi internet in the house. The WiFi is high speed and the TV has free Netflix and Hulu to watch. There is also a kitchen which is open to a dining room / kitchen table for 4 people. The bedroom is very spacious and has a huge closet. The apartment also has a great PRIVATE patio behind the apartment under the trees with a wood seating area and table for 4 people. The apartment gets tons of light and the patio is great for having a morning coffee in the California Sunshine. The neighborhood is also great. My apartment is located in the best location in Los Angeles, it is on the border of Beverly Hills and West Hollywood. There are many places to walk from my apartment but it's also very centrally located in LA: LAX Airport: 20 minutes by car The Grove: 5 minutes by car Santa Monica Pier: 20 minutes by car Hollywood Walk of Fame: 10 minutes by car Venice Boardwalk: 30 minutes by car The area has many things to do, from the best restaurants to the best shopping and sightseeing. It is also in the center of LA so it is easy to get around to different places. So many great places to walk to including coffee shops and museums. The apartment is also located next to Cedars Sinai Hospital. Although you probably have heard and know all about Beverly Hills, here is a bit about the WeHo which might be useful. "When it comes to style, design, and decor, West Hollywood, or WeHo, ranks highly. WeHo means being just off of Melrose and walking distance to all shops/restaurants on Beverly, La Cienega, Fairfax, Melrose, Farmer's Market, The Grove and the Beverly Center. Walk the Sunset Strip and wander Melrose District by day. Twirl, sip, and swirl by night—WeHo is a 24/7 destination. The Sunset Strip and Sunset Plaza remain entertainment destinations for locals and visitors looking for stylish respites in an urban setting. Bookstores, art galleries, yoga studios, and cross-fit bootcamps line up along the Sunset Strip. Bars, lounges, music venues, comedy clubs, and performance galleries invite nighttime walkers, gawkers and dancers. The location is perfect with tons of shopping, restaurant, bars, galleries, and hiking within minutes of walking or by car. Renowned for its shopping, dining, and entertainment options, Melrose District doesn't disappoint. The parade of boutiques, eateries, and venues begins at WeHo's border with Beverly Hills and stretches all the way to Silver Lake, another LA favorite for hip exploration. Home to Pacific Design Center and Museum of Contemporary Art, LA Pacific Design Center, WeHo promotes conscientious creation and spatial shaping."
                      </div>
                      <!-- react-text: 1030 -->
                      <!-- /react-text -->
                      <div data-reactid="1031">
                       <li data-reactid="1032"><p data-reactid="1033">Made the reservation pretty last minute, but Nazila made sure to get me taken care of as quick as she could.                     <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="1157">
                     <div data-reactid="1158">
                      <div data-reactid="1159">
                       Clean and contemporary apartment located in West Los Angeles, with well lit living room space, a couch that can easily be converted to an extra bed, and a dining nook in the cozy kitchen to give you that feel of home away from home. Comes with free high speed internet and a parking permit. Prime location that is neighboring Beverly Hills and West Hollywood, giving you so many options on places to visit and dine at get the perfect Los Angeles experience. You'll love the the living room windows!
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1160">
                       Free high speed internet and one parking space permit for street parking available, with more free street parking if needed around the corner. The apartment is located in a friendly neighborhood, away from the crazy hollywood noise but is also a drive away from all the nightlife in Los Angeles. Drive to downtown los angeles and check out the Disney Concert Hall and it’s incredible structure. Choose a conservancy walking tour and learn all about the structures in downtown LA and stroll around Pershing square. A 20 minute drive or the metro expo line can also take you towards Santa Monica. Lots of amazing restaurants, bars and shops all along 3rd street promenade or just walk towards the Pier and check out the mini amusement park by the Pier. Want to get in touch with nature, many parks in the neighborhood, from the Roxbury park in Beverly Hills or just walk around La Cienega Park. This apartment location gives you so many things to choose from and some are at a walking distance while others are a maximum 20-30 minute drive away.
                      </div>

The apartment is in the best location in Los Angeles, right between Beverly Hills, West Hollywood and West LA. The wide, tree lined streets just south of Burton Way is of the most beautiful and prestiges areas in the city, while still being very centrally located. A great launching point to enjoy the city. Steps away from the restaurants, coffee shops and shopping on Robertson, Melrose and Santa Monica blvd. The Beverly Center mall and the Grove mall are also nearby. Finally, the apartment is conveniently located steps from Cedars Sinai Hospital. The spacious floor plan has a large living room, a dining area, and kitchen. The large bedroom has plenty of closet space, and a comfortable brand new queen sized bed, with elegant wooden frames and matching night stands and cabinets. For additional sleeping, the couch in the living room converts into a full sized bed. Additional air mattress can be provided upon request.

                       My place is perfect if you are trying to see or visit LA! It is in a great location, right in the middle of West Hollywood / Beverly Hills. In the living room there is a comfortable couch sofa that changes into a queen size mattress bed. The kitchen opens into the dining area that is also connected to the living room.                     <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="1496">
                     <div data-reactid="1497">
                      <div data-reactid="1498">
                       High end 2 bdrm apartment with tons of amenities BEST LOCATION!! Heart of Beverly Hills / West Hollywood, Walking distance from LA's top restaurants and shopping NEAR - Beverly Center, Cedars Sinai, Rodeo Drive Includes WiFi TV HULU NETFLIX
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1499">
                       This perfect two bedroom apartment has recently been renovated and has all new furnishings. It is also fully equipped with amenities including a WiFi enabled television with FREE Hulu &amp; Netflix access. The apartment is in the best location in Los Angeles, right between Beverly Hills, West Hollywood and West LA. The wide, tree lined streets just south of Burton Way is of the most beautiful and prestiges areas in the city, while still being very centrally located. A great launching point to enjoy the city. Steps away from the restaurants, coffee shops and shopping on Robertson, Melrose and Santa Monica blvd. The Beverly Center mall and the Grove mall are also nearby. Finally, the apartment is conveniently located steps from Cedars Sinai Hospital. The spacious floor plan has a very large living room, a dining area, and kitchen. The two large bedrooms have plenty of closet space and are separated by a bathroom, which gives added privacy. Both bedrooms have comfortable queen size beds, with elegant wooden frames and matching night stands and cabinets. For additional sleeping, the couch in the living room converts into a full sized bed. Additional air mattress can be provided upon request.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1500">
                       Here are a few of my favorite places in the neighborhood, all of which are walking distance. I hope you have a chance to explore them! Best Restaurant: AOC - gourmet casual dining and wine bar with great atmosphere. Best Coffee Shop: The Larder - great brunch, sandwiches and salads to have with a good coffee. Best Dessert: Lady M - if you have not tried the crepe layer cake, you must! Best Place to Spot a Celebrity: The Ivy - expensive, but excellent restaurant where people go to see and be seen.
                      </div>

                       <li data-reactid="1510"><p data-reactid="1511">Jeff is a great host with a very nice 2 bedroom apartment in a great location. Super clean. Great towels. There are ceiling fans in the bedrooms, but not enough to cool things down when it gets that hot. </p><span data-reactid="1512">Dale</span><span data-reactid="1513">2016-06-22T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                    <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="1627">
                     <div data-reactid="1628">
                      <div data-reactid="1629">
                       Two story 3 bedroom, 2 1/2 bathroom duplex very close to The Grove. You will have your own bedroom/bathroom, with a queen sized bed W/Ralph Lauren bedding,Flat Screen TV. Wireless internet and cable, weekly maid service and central heat and air.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1630">
                       This beautiful 2-story 2500 sq duplex is in a great location on a tree-lined street close to everything!! The room for rent is actually the master with an attached bathroom with a bath/shower. The large window overlooks the back yard. The room itself is large with two large mirrored closets. There is a queen sized bed with Ralph Lauren bedding a large 42' flat screen TV, cable (every channel) apple TV, and wireless internet. There is central AC/Heating. I have weekly maid service, she will clean your room/bathroom and wash all the sheets and towels. I want you to feel free to move around and be comfortable. You will have full access to the house. I want you to feel free to move around and be comfortable. There is a washer/dryer downstairs and a small yard out back with a table and chairs, a bbq, fire-pit and heat lamp. I have 3 bedrooms, two are masters and an office/guest-room in between that no one is in. This is very close to the grove in LA as well as 3rd Street. There is street parking only (but very easy to find) I do have 2 small dogs and 1 very sweet cat. I do keep that guest-room door shut always so you don't have to be smothered with kisses unless you want to be. This duplex is in the heart of Los Angeles, and walking distance from all the good stuff in LA. The bathroom will be stocked with a toothbrush, tooth-paste, q-tips and cotton pads, disposable razors, lotion, shampoo and conditioner etc. There is also a brand new blow dryer inside.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1631">
                       This duplex is in the heart of Los Angeles, and walking distance from all the good stuff in LA. This neighborhood is a cozy, friendly and safe place to relax and explore! Everyone in this area is active, so its nice to wake up and start your day with a cup of coffee and go for a nice walk in the early morning or walk to 3rd for a juice at Juice Served Here or a coffee at Joan's on 3rd. The tree lined street and beautiful 1920's / 30's architecture create pictorial scenery for your forays around the neighborhood. The area feels very private and quiet yet the hustle and bustle of the city is just blocks away.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1632">
                       <li data-reactid="1633"><p data-reactid="1634">Caroline's place was a great choice I made for my first time visiting Airbnb. She was very accommodating and even stayed up late to wait, as we arrived late in the evening, to make sure we settled in well. Her place was very clean and nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable to sleep in and her bed sheets were very clean. The washroom was not only very clean but also equipped with everything we needed from shampoo, conditioner, q-tips, and even new toothbrushes. Caroline's neighborhood was very safe to be in during the evenings and is very convenient. It was a 10-15min walk to LACMA, and also 10-15min walk to 3rd Ave where there were tons of shops and places to eat. Ubering to all the tourist destinations was always under $10. She has super friendly pets that we even became attached to before leaving. She also was there to give us tips about the city and what are some great local restaurants to check out. Thank you for the great stay Caroline! The next time I come back to LA I will for sure be staying at Caroline's place again. </p><span data-reactid="1635">Jessica</span><span data-reactid="1636">2015-12-29T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                     <div data-reactid="1752">
                      <div data-reactid="1753">
                       Cozy &amp; elegant relaxing one bedroom in beautiful historical Carthay Circle. Close to West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Downtown L.A., The Grove Shopping Center, 3rd Street boutique shopping district, The Farmer's Market, LACMA art Museum, Hollywood Walk of Fame &amp; all Major freeways. Located Approx 20 min to LAX and Santa Monica beaches.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1754">
                       This charming private Room (with own entrance) is in a beautiful upscale residence appointed with classic modern and vintage style furniture, beautiful art work and A super Comfortable queen size bed with luxurious bedding for a perfect nights sleep. In the morning help yourself to a fresh cup of coffee and kick back with a book or newspaper and enjoy our charming brick patio and lush back yard with fragrant herbal garden. Also have 40" smart flat screen TV and parking. We take pride in 5 star hospitality in making our home a special experience for our guests.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1755">
                       We live in an "historical preservation" neighborhood developed in 1926 located in the heart of Los Angeles. Our tree line streets, manecured yards and landscaping with amazing English and Spanish architecture makes this neighborhood a diamond in the rough, a peaceful retreat amongst the hustle bustle of La La Land. There are beautiful walking paths throughout the neighborhood and friendly and respectful neighbors.
                      </div>

                       <li data-reactid="1757"><p data-reactid="1758">Randy's place was very cozy and quiet. I enjoyed his garden patio area off the library room where I slept. The kitchen was between the bathroom and the bedroom and Randy kindly left me treats and coffee each morning and afternoon.                     <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="1878">
                     <div data-reactid="1879">
                      <div data-reactid="1880">
                       This apartment has 2 spacious bedrooms and 1 bathroom with great features! A comfortable living area with a sofa that can be turned into an extra bed and a dining area that is connected to a kitchen space making it a very spacious. Has a great view of the neighborhood and making it a naturally well-lit apartment. Prime location with a lot of tourist attractions like the Sunset Strip, Downtown LA, Santa Monica and Venice all within a radius of 20 minute drive. Parking space and wifi included!
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="1881">
                       Located in a friendly neighborhood, this 2 bedroom 1 bath with spacious living space is perfect if you’re looking for something clean and close to most of what Los Angeles has to offer. This location is walkable to most LA’s prime locations and also has public transport close by too. The apartment has a great view and comes with free high speed internet, a couch in the living room that can be turned into an extra bed and one parking space. Lots of street parking is available too. You enter into the unit in the living room and the kitchen is open to a dining nook in between. Through a separate hallway you go through to both bedrooms, which do not share a wall and are very private across the hallway from each other. With sunset strip and west hollywood a 10 minute drive, you are right in the heart of all the hip and happening locations, from great restaurants, bars and live music venues, you get to experience all that Los Angeles night life is about. While you’re in West Hollywood, don’t forget to try out the Pink’s Hot Dog, the famous iconic hot dog stand! If you’re interested in arts and museum, the Los Angeles County Museum of Art- LACMA is a 10 minute drive and about a 20 minute walk or make it a beach day by driving down to Santa Monica or walk along the pier. This apartment not only gives you the comfortable living space you’re looking for but it’s perfect for checking out all the touristy things Los Angeles has to offer.
                      </div>

                       <li data-reactid="2008"><p data-reactid="2009">We stayed in G's place for 2 nights on a stopover from New Zealand to the UK. The place was exactly as anticipated and matched the description and photos accurately. It was very clean on our arrival and the newly renovated kitchen and bathroom are a nice touch. The kitchen is very well equipped meaning we could cook if we wanted to but we just took advantage of the local takeaways. G was proactive in making contact and also responsive whenever we had a question. Only piece of constructive feedback would be that a door between the kitchen and the hallway would be good as the noise from the lounge/TV travels to the bedroom. It wasn't such an issue for us but if you have one person who wants to stay up a bit later and watch TV and another person who wants to go to sleep and they are a lite sleeper they may need ear plugs. </p><span data-reactid="2010">Tane</span><span data-reactid="2011">2016-07-30T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                     <div data-reactid="2355">
                      <div data-reactid="2356">
                       The apartment is located in the desirable neighborhood of West Hollywood, walking distance to everything on 3rd Street, Melrose Ave, Melrose Place, and Beverly Blvd. The apartment itself is calm and quiet with a front patio overlooking a small garden
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="2357">
                       Nestled in the middle of Los Angeles, this stylish 2 bedroom, 2 bath, West Hollywood apartment is central to all things amazing Los Angeles has to offer. It is walking distance to 5 star/Michelin &amp; Zagat rated restaurants, high end nightlife, and some of the best shopping in all of LA (The Grove, The Beverly Center, The Beverly Connection, boutique stores on 3rd, Beverly, and Fairfax). It is a short drive to Rodeo Drive, Hollywood, Silverlake and Echo Park, and hiking in the famous Runyon Canyon, and just 30 minutes to the beaches of Santa Monica and Venice. If you are looking to take in all the pocket neighborhoods that Los Angeles has to offer, this apartment is the perfect base to call home during your stay. The apartment has everything you need including shampoo and toiletries. Just bring yourself and your clothes of course! The kitchen is fully functional and the dining room and patio are the perfect place to host small dinners. There is public transportation just a few blocks walking distance and there is one parking spot that is underground and gated for extra safety. There are two small gyms close by and if this is of interest to you I can arrange for a short term membership. As well, I have many connections in the city to high end restaurants and clubs and would be happy to facilitate you getting in to some of the harder to reach places. You will have your own private bedroom and own private bathroom. I also rent out the entire apartment. Please inquire about pricing for this arrangement and/or see my other listing.
                      </div>
                      <div data-reactid="2358">
                       It is quiet for being in the middle of the city and it is close to everything in the city and very walkable.
